question: What bird did Noah send out first from the ark?
explanation: Noah first sent out a raven, which kept flying back and forth until the water dried up.

verses.kjv: And he sent forth a raven, which went forth to and fro, until the waters were dried up from off the earth.

question: Who was born holding his twin brother's heel?
explanation: Jacob was born with his hand grasping Esau's heel, which is why he was named Jacob (meaning 'he grasps the heel').

verses.kjv:
And after that came his brother out, and his hand took hold on Esau’s heel; and his name was called Jacob: and Isaac
was threescore years old when she bare them.

question: What kind of tree was in the middle of the Garden of Eden besides the tree of knowledge?
explanation: In the middle of the garden were the tree of life and the tree of the knowledge of good and evil.

verses.kjv: And out of the ground made the LORD God to grow every tree that is pleasant to the sight, and good for food; the tree of life also in the midst of the garden, and the tree of knowledge of good and evil.

question: What covered the earth before God separated the waters?
explanation: The earth was formless and empty, darkness was over the surface of the deep, and the Spirit of God hovered.

verses.kjv:
And the earth was without form, and void; and darkness
was
 upon the face of the deep. And the Spirit of God moved upon the face of the waters.

question: What did Enoch do that was unique among early humans?
choices: Walked with God and was taken up without dying
explanation: Enoch walked faithfully with God; then he was no more, because God took him away.

verses.kjv:
And Enoch walked with God: and he
was not; for God took him.

question: What did the serpent tell Eve would happen if she ate the fruit?
choices: You will be like God, knowing good and evil
explanation: For God knows that when you eat from it your eyes will be opened, and you will be like God, knowing good and evil.

verses.kjv: For God doth know that in the day ye eat thereof, then your eyes shall be opened, and ye shall be as gods, knowing good and evil.

question: On which day did God create the sun, moon, and stars?
explanation: God made two great lights and the stars, and set them in the vault of the sky on the fourth day.

verses.kjv:
And God made two great lights; the greater light to rule the day, and the lesser light to rule the night:
he made the stars also.
And God set them in the firmament of the heaven to give light upon the earth,
And to rule over the day and over the night, and to divide the light from the darkness: and God saw that
it was good.
And the evening and the morning were the fourth day.

question: What did God create on the second day?
explanation: God made the expanse and separated the water under it from the water above it, calling it 'sky.'

verses.kjv:
And God made the firmament, and divided the waters which
were
 under the firmament from the waters which
were above the firmament: and it was so.

question: What was Adam's job in the Garden of Eden?
choices: To work it and take care of it
To guard the tree of life
explanation: God placed Adam in the Garden of Eden to work it and take care of it.

verses.kjv: And the LORD God took the man, and put him into the garden of Eden to dress it and to keep it.

question: What kind of tree was in the middle of the Garden of Eden?
choices: Tree of life and tree of knowledge
explanation: In the middle of the garden were the tree of life and the tree of the knowledge of good and evil.

verses.kjv: And out of the ground made the LORD God to grow every tree that is pleasant to the sight, and good for food; the tree of life also in the midst of the garden, and the tree of knowledge of good and evil.

question: What did God put in the east of Eden after expelling Adam?
explanation: God placed cherubim and a flaming sword flashing back and forth to guard the way to the tree of life.

verses.kjv: So he drove out the man; and he placed at the east of the garden of Eden Cherubim, and a flaming sword which turned every way, to keep the way of the tree of life.

question: What was the name of the third son of Adam and Eve?
explanation: Adam made love to his wife again, and she gave birth to a son and named him Seth.

verses.kjv:
And Adam knew his wife again; and she bare a son, and called his name Seth: For God,
said she, hath appointed me another seed instead of Abel, whom Cain slew.

question: What did God place to guard the way to the tree of life?
explanation: He placed on the east side of the Garden of Eden cherubim and a flaming sword flashing back and forth to guard the way to the tree of life.

verses.kjv: So he drove out the man; and he placed at the east of the garden of Eden Cherubim, and a flaming sword which turned every way, to keep the way of the tree of life.

question: What did the serpent say would happen if they ate from the forbidden tree?
choices: Their eyes would be opened and they would be like God
explanation: For God knows that when you eat from it your eyes will be opened, and you will be like God, knowing good and evil.

verses.kjv: For God doth know that in the day ye eat thereof, then your eyes shall be opened, and ye shall be as gods, knowing good and evil.

question: What was Cain's occupation?
explanation: Now Abel kept flocks, and Cain worked the soil.

verses.kjv: And she again bare his brother Abel. And Abel was a keeper of sheep, but Cain was a tiller of the ground.

question: What two trees were in the middle of the Garden of Eden?
choices: Tree of life and tree of knowledge of good and evil
Tree of life and tree of wisdom
Tree of knowledge and tree of death
Tree of life and tree of heaven
explanation: In the middle of the garden were the tree of life and the tree of the knowledge of good and evil.

verses.kjv: And out of the ground made the LORD God to grow every tree that is pleasant to the sight, and good for food; the tree of life also in the midst of the garden, and the tree of knowledge of good and evil.

question: What happened to Enoch?
explanation: Enoch walked faithfully with God; then he was no more, because God took him away.

verses.kjv:
And Enoch walked with God: and he
was not; for God took him.

question: What did God see about mankind that grieved His heart?
explanation: The Lord saw how great the wickedness of the human race had become on the earth, and that every inclination of the thoughts of the human heart was only evil all the time.

verses.kjv:
And GOD saw that the wickedness of man
was great in the earth, and
that every imagination of the thoughts of his heart
was
 only evil continually.

question: What did God separate on the second day?
explanation: And God said, 'Let there be a vault between the waters to separate water from water.' So God made the vault and separated the water under the vault from the water above it.

verses.kjv:
And God said, Let there be a firmament in the midst of the waters, and let it divide the waters from the waters.
And God made the firmament, and divided the waters which
were
 under the firmament from the waters which
were above the firmament: and it was so.

question: What did God call the vault between the waters?
explanation: God called the vault 'sky.' And there was evening, and there was morning—the second day.

verses.kjv: And God called the firmament Heaven. And the evening and the morning were the second day.

question: On which day did God create vegetation?
explanation: Then God said, 'Let the land produce vegetation.' And there was evening, and there was morning—the third day.

verses.kjv:
And God said, Let the earth bring forth grass, the herb yielding seed,
and the fruit tree yielding fruit after his kind, whose seed
is in itself, upon the earth: and it was so.
And the earth brought forth grass,
and herb yielding seed after his kind, and the tree yielding fruit, whose seed
was in itself, after his kind: and God saw that
it was good.
And the evening and the morning were the third day.

question: What was the name of the land where Cain went after killing Abel?
explanation: So Cain went out from the Lord's presence and lived in the land of Nod, east of Eden.

verses.kjv: And Cain went out from the presence of the LORD, and dwelt in the land of Nod, on the east of Eden.

question: Who was the father of all who play stringed instruments and pipes?
explanation: His brother's name was Jubal; he was the father of all who play stringed instruments and pipes.

verses.kjv:
And his brother’s name
was Jubal: he was the father of all such as handle the harp and organ.

question: How old was Adam when Seth was born?
explanation: When Adam had lived 130 years, he had a son in his own likeness, in his own image; and he named him Seth.

verses.kjv:
And Adam lived an hundred and thirty years, and begat
a son
 in his own likeness, after his image; and called his name Seth:

question: What was the first man's name, according to the genealogy in Genesis?
explanation: Genesis 5:1 begins the genealogy by naming "Adam."

verses.kjv: This is the book of the generations of Adam. In the day that God created man, in the likeness of God made he him;

question: After forming man from the dust, what did God breathe into his nostrils?
explanation: Genesis 2:7 says God breathed "the breath of life" into man's nostrils.

verses.kjv: And the LORD God formed man of the dust of the ground, and breathed into his nostrils the breath of life; and man became a living soul.

question: Where did the LORD God plant a garden for man to be placed?
explanation: Genesis 2:8 says God planted a garden "eastward in Eden" and put the man there.

verses.kjv: And the LORD God planted a garden eastward in Eden; and there he put the man whom he had formed.

question: What did the LORD God make to grow from the ground that was pleasant to the sight and good for food?
explanation: Genesis 2:9 says the LORD God made "every tree" to grow that was pleasant and good for food.

verses.kjv: And out of the ground made the LORD God to grow every tree that is pleasant to the sight, and good for food; the tree of life also in the midst of the garden, and the tree of knowledge of good and evil.

question: What two special trees are named as being in the midst of the garden?
choices: The tree of life and the tree of knowledge of good and evil
The tree of peace and the tree of war
The tree of wisdom and the tree of folly
The tree of blessing and the tree of curse
explanation: Genesis 2:9 specifically names these two trees in the midst of the garden.

verses.kjv: And out of the ground made the LORD God to grow every tree that is pleasant to the sight, and good for food; the tree of life also in the midst of the garden, and the tree of knowledge of good and evil.

question: What did the LORD God say was "not good" in the Garden?
choices: That the man should be alone
That the trees were too many
explanation: Genesis 2:18 says it was not good for the man to be alone, so God would make him an help meet.

verses.kjv: And the LORD God said, It is not good that the man should be alone; I will make him an help meet for him.

question: What did the LORD God form out of the ground and bring to Adam to see what he would call them?
choices: Every beast of the field and every fowl of the air
explanation: Genesis 2:19 says God formed beasts and fowls and brought them to Adam to name them.

verses.kjv: And out of the ground the LORD God formed every beast of the field, and every fowl of the air; and brought them unto Adam to see what he would call them: and whatsoever Adam called every living creature, that was the name thereof.

question: What did God cause to fall upon Adam before taking one of his ribs?
explanation: Genesis 2:21 says the LORD God caused a deep sleep to fall upon Adam.

verses.kjv: And the LORD God caused a deep sleep to fall upon Adam, and he slept: and he took one of his ribs, and closed up the flesh instead thereof;

question: What did Adam say the woman should be called because she was taken out of man?
explanation: Genesis 2:23 records Adam saying she shall be called Woman because she was taken out of Man.

verses.kjv: And Adam said, This is now bone of my bones, and flesh of my flesh: she shall be called Woman, because she was taken out of Man.

question: In the warning about the forbidden tree, what did God say would happen in the day Adam ate of it?
choices: Thou shalt surely be cast out
Thou shalt surely forget thy name
explanation: Genesis 2:17 states that eating of the tree would bring certain death.

verses.kjv: But of the tree of the knowledge of good and evil, thou shalt not eat of it: for in the day that thou eatest thereof thou shalt surely die.

question: When the serpent spoke to the woman, what did he say their eyes would be opened to become "as"?
explanation: Genesis 3:5 records the serpent claiming they would be "as gods" knowing good and evil.

verses.kjv: For God doth know that in the day ye eat thereof, then your eyes shall be opened, and ye shall be as gods, knowing good and evil.

question: After Adam and Eve ate, what did they make to cover themselves?
explanation: Genesis 3:7 says they sewed fig leaves together and made themselves aprons.

verses.kjv: And the eyes of them both were opened, and they knew that they were naked; and they sewed fig leaves together, and made themselves aprons.

question: What did Adam and his wife do when they heard the voice of the LORD God walking in the garden?
choices: Hid themselves among the trees of the garden
Ran to the rivers of Eden
explanation: Genesis 3:8 states they hid themselves from the presence of the LORD God among the trees.

verses.kjv: And they heard the voice of the LORD God walking in the garden in the cool of the day: and Adam and his wife hid themselves from the presence of the LORD God amongst the trees of the garden.

question: What did the LORD God say the ground would bring forth for Adam because of the curse?
explanation: Genesis 3:18 says the ground would bring forth "thorns also and thistles" to Adam.

verses.kjv: Thorns also and thistles shall it bring forth to thee; and thou shalt eat the herb of the field;

question: What did the LORD God make for Adam and for his wife after the fall?
explanation: Genesis 3:21 says the LORD God made coats of skins and clothed them.

verses.kjv: Unto Adam also and to his wife did the LORD God make coats of skins, and clothed them.

question: What did the LORD God place at the east of the garden of Eden to keep the way of the tree of life?
choices: Cherubims, and a flaming sword which turned every way
A wall of stone and iron gates
A flood of waters and strong winds
explanation: Genesis 3:24 describes cherubims and a flaming sword guarding the way to the tree of life.

verses.kjv: So he drove out the man; and he placed at the east of the garden of Eden Cherubims, and a flaming sword which turned every way, to keep the way of the tree of life.

question: What was Cain's offering to the LORD?
choices: Of the fruit of the ground
A burnt offering of a ram
explanation: Genesis 4:3 says Cain brought of the fruit of the ground an offering unto the LORD.

verses.kjv: And in process of time it came to pass, that Cain brought of the fruit of the ground an offering unto the LORD.

question: What did Abel bring as an offering to the LORD?
choices: Of the firstlings of his flock and of the fat thereof
Of the fruit of the ground
A basket of herbs and spices
explanation: Genesis 4:4 says Abel brought the firstlings of his flock and of the fat thereof.

verses.kjv: And Abel, he also brought of the firstlings of his flock and of the fat thereof. And the LORD had respect unto Abel and to his offering:

question: What did the LORD say to Cain about sin at the door?
choices: Unto thee shall be his desire, and thou shalt rule over him
Thou shalt flee to the mountains
Thou shalt be forgiven without repentance
Thou shalt become king over many cities
explanation: Genesis 4:7 warns Cain that sin lies at the door, but he is to rule over it.

verses.kjv: If thou doest well, shalt thou not be accepted? and if thou doest not well, sin lieth at the door. And unto thee shall be his desire, and thou shalt rule over him.

question: What did Cain do to Abel when they were in the field?
choices: Rose up against Abel his brother, and slew him
Gave Abel a portion of his fruit
Left the field and returned home
explanation: Genesis 4:8 states that Cain rose up against Abel and killed him.

verses.kjv: And Cain talked with Abel his brother: and it came to pass, when they were in the field, that Cain rose up against Abel his brother, and slew him.

question: After Cain killed Abel, what did the LORD say Abel's blood did from the ground?
explanation: Genesis 4:10 records God saying Abel's blood cried unto Him from the ground.

verses.kjv: And he said, What hast thou done? the voice of thy brother's blood crieth unto me from the ground.

question: What sign did the LORD set on Cain after his punishment was announced?
choices: A mark, lest any finding him should kill him
explanation: Genesis 4:15 says the LORD set a mark upon Cain so he would not be killed by anyone who found him.

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto him, Therefore whosoever slayeth Cain, vengeance shall be taken on him sevenfold. And the LORD set a mark upon Cain, lest any finding him should kill him.

question: How does Genesis describe what happened to Enoch?
choices: He was not; for God took him
He was made king in his city
He was carried away by the flood
explanation: Genesis 5:24 says Enoch walked with God, and then "God took him."

verses.kjv: And Enoch walked with God: and he was not; for God took him.

question: What did the LORD say he would do to man because he was made flesh?
choices: Yet his days shall be an hundred and twenty years
explanation: Genesis 6:3 states that man's days would be 120 years.

verses.kjv: And the LORD said, My spirit shall not always strive with man, for that he also is flesh: yet his days shall be an hundred and twenty years.

question: What kind of ark did God tell Noah to make?
explanation: Genesis 6:14 specifically commands Noah to make the ark of gopher wood.

verses.kjv: Make thee an ark of gopher wood; rooms shalt thou make in the ark, and shalt pitch it within and without with pitch.

question: What did the LORD say he would bring upon the earth to destroy all flesh?
explanation: Genesis 6:17 says God would bring a flood of waters upon the earth to destroy all flesh with the breath of life.

verses.kjv: And, behold, I, even I, do bring a flood of waters upon the earth, to destroy all flesh, wherein is the breath of life, from under heaven; and every thing that is in the earth shall die.
